page.title: 07Brinklow C.E. First School
page.content: The{original school}was built in 1827 and is believed to be one of the oldest school buildings still in use in Warwickshire.It was extended in 1855 and later a further annexe was opened a little way from the main building,Vine Cottage being between them.Children attend this school from 4+ to 8 years when they transfer to {Brockhurst Middle School}at Monks Kirby some 4 miles away.All subjects are taught with an emphisis on learning through direct practical experiences and much use is made of the rich local environment which includes the Tump,canal and farms.The school holds several{events}annually to which parents and other members of the community are invited.These include an Easter Bonnet Parade,egg rolling on the Tump,May Fair,Harvest Festival and Christmas Activities.
